parameters.description: Application's name

parameters.description: Application's name

parameters.description: Specify which event types to allow/disallow
parameters.name: filter

put.description:
Allowed and/or disallowed event type filtering can be done. The body (parameter) should specify a JSON key/value object that describes the type of event filtering needed. One, or both of the following keys can be designated:

"allowed" - Specifies an allowed list of event types
"disallowed" - Specifies a disallowed list of event types

Further, each of those key's value should be a JSON array that holds zero, or more JSON key/value objects. Each of these objects must contain the following key with an associated value:

"type" - The type name of the event to filter

The value must be the string name (case sensitive) of the event type that needs filtering. For example:

{ "allowed": [ { "type": "StasisStart" }, { "type": "StasisEnd" } ] }

As this specifies only an allowed list, then only those two event type messages are sent to the application. No other event messages are sent.

The following rules apply:

* If the body is empty, both the allowed and disallowed filters are set empty.
* If both list types are given then both are set to their respective values (note, specifying an empty array for a given type sets that type to empty).
* If only one list type is given then only that type is set. The other type is not updated.
* An empty "allowed" list means all events are allowed.
* An empty "disallowed" list means no events are disallowed.
* Disallowed events take precedence over allowed events if the event type is specified in both lists.

allOf.description: Notification that trying to move a channel to another Stasis application failed.

Notification that another WebSocket has taken over for an application.

An application may only be subscribed to by a single WebSocket at a time. If multiple WebSockets attempt to subscribe to the same application, the newer WebSocket wins, and the older one receives this event.

build.description: Info about how Asterisk was built

system.description: Info about the system running Asterisk

timestamp.description: The timestamp string of request received time

Bridge.description:
The merging of media from one or more channels.

Everyone on the bridge receives the same audio.

channels.description: Ids of channels participating in this bridge

name.description: Name the creator gave the bridge

technology.description: Name of the current bridging technology

video_mode.description: The video mode the bridge is using. One of 'none', 'talker', or 'single'.

video_source_id.description: The ID of the channel that is the source of video in this bridge, if one exists.

allOf.description: Notification that an attended transfer has occurred.

destination_application.description: Application that has been transferred into

destination_bridge.description: Bridge that survived the merge result

destination_link_first_leg.description: First leg of a link transfer result

destination_link_second_leg.description: Second leg of a link transfer result

destination_threeway_bridge.description: Bridge that survived the threeway result

destination_threeway_channel.description: Transferer channel that survived the threeway result

is_external.description: Whether the transfer was externally initiated or not

replace_channel.description: The channel that is replacing transferer_first_leg in the swap

result.description: The result of the transfer attempt

transfer_target.description: The channel that is being transferred to

transferee.description: The channel that is being transferred

transferer_first_leg_bridge.description: Bridge the transferer first leg is in

transferer_second_leg_bridge.description: Bridge the transferer second leg is in

allOf.description: Notification that a blind transfer has occurred.

channel.description: The channel performing the blind transfer

is_external.description: Whether the transfer was externally initiated or not

replace_channel.description: The channel that is replacing transferer when the transferee(s) can not be transferred directly

result.description: The result of the transfer attempt

transferee.description: The channel that is being transferred

allOf.description: Notification that a bridge has been created.
Notification that a bridge has been destroyed.
Notification that one bridge has merged into another.
Bridge variable changed.

bridge.description: The bridge on which the variable was set.

value.description: The new value of the variable.

allOf.description: Notification that the source of video in a bridge has changed.

BuildInfo.description: Info about how Asterisk was built

date.description: Date and time when Asterisk was built.

kernel.description: Kernel version Asterisk was built on.

options.description: Compile time options, or empty string if default.

Channel.description: A specific communication connection between Asterisk and an Endpoint.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the channel.

This is the same as the Uniqueid field in AMI.

allOf.description: Channel changed Caller ID.

caller_presentation.description: The integer representation of the Caller Presentation value.

caller_presentation_txt.description: The text representation of the Caller Presentation value.

channel.description: The channel that changed Caller ID.

allOf.description: Channel changed Connected Line.

channel.description: The channel whose connected line has changed.

allOf.description: Notification that a channel has been created.
Notification that a channel has been destroyed.

cause.description: Integer representation of the cause of the hangup

cause_txt.description: Text representation of the cause of the hangup

allOf.description: Channel changed location in the dialplan.

channel.description: The channel that changed dialplan location.

dialplan_app.description: The application about to be executed.

dialplan_app_data.description: The data to be passed to the application.

allOf.description:
DTMF received on a channel.

This event is sent when the DTMF ends. There is no notification about the start of DTMF

channel.description: The channel on which DTMF was received

duration_ms.description: Number of milliseconds DTMF was received

allOf.description: Notification that a channel has entered a bridge.
A hangup was requested on the channel.

cause.description: Integer representation of the cause of the hangup.

channel.description: The channel on which the hangup was requested.

soft.description: Whether the hangup request was a soft hangup request.

allOf.description: A channel initiated a media hold.

channel.description: The channel that initiated the hold event.

musicclass.description: The music on hold class that the initiator requested.

allOf.description: Notification that a channel has left a bridge.
MOH started on the channel.

channel.description: The channel on which the MOH started.

moh_class.description: The name of the MOH class that started

allOf.description: MOH stopped on the channel.

channel.description: The channel on which the MOH stopped.

allOf.description: Notification of a channel's state change.
Talking is no longer detected on the channel.

channel.description: The channel on which talking completed.

duration.description: The length of time, in milliseconds, that talking was detected on the channel

allOf.description: Talking was detected on the channel.

channel.description: The channel on which talking started.

allOf.description: A channel initiated a media unhold.

channel.description: The channel that initiated the unhold event.

allOf.description: User-generated event with additional user-defined fields in the object.

bridge.description: A bridge that is signaled with the user event.

channel.description: A channel that is signaled with the user event.

endpoint.description: A endpoint that is signaled with the user event.

eventname.description: The name of the user event.

allOf.description: Channel variable changed.

channel.description:
The channel on which the variable was set.

If missing, the variable is a global variable.

value.description: The new value of the variable.

max_open_files.description: Maximum number of open file handles (files, sockets).

setid.description: Effective user/group id for running Asterisk.

ConfigTuple.description: A key/value pair that makes up part of a configuration object.

ContactInfo.description: Detailed information about a contact on an endpoint.

aor.description: The Address of Record this contact belongs to.

contact_status.description: The current status of the contact.

roundtrip_usec.description: Current round trip time, in microseconds, for the contact.

allOf.description: The state of a contact on an endpoint has changed.

DeviceState.description: Represents the state of a device.

allOf.description: Notification that a device state has changed.
Dialing state has changed.

dialstatus.description: Current status of the dialing attempt to the peer.

dialstring.description: The dial string for calling the peer channel.

forward.description: Forwarding target requested by the original dialed channel.

forwarded.description: Channel that the caller has been forwarded to.

Endpoint.description:
An external device that may offer/accept calls to/from Asterisk.

Unlike most resources, which have a single unique identifier, an endpoint is uniquely identified by the technology/resource pair.

channel_ids.description: Id's of channels associated with this endpoint

resource.description: Identifier of the endpoint, specific to the given technology.

allOf.description: Endpoint state changed.
Base type for asynchronous events from Asterisk.

application.description: Name of the application receiving the event.

timestamp.description: Time at which this event was created.

channel.description: The Asterisk channel representing the external media

FormatLangPair.description: Identifies the format and language of a sound file

LiveRecording.description: A recording that is in progress

cause.description: Cause for recording failure if failed

duration.description: Duration in seconds of the recording

silence_duration.description: Duration of silence, in seconds, detected in the recording. This is only available if the recording was initiated with a non-zero maxSilenceSeconds.

talking_duration.description: Duration of talking, in seconds, detected in the recording. This is only available if the recording was initiated with a non-zero maxSilenceSeconds.

target_uri.description: URI for the channel or bridge being recorded

LogChannel.description: Details of an Asterisk log channel

status.description: Whether or not a log type is enabled

type.description: Types of logs for the log channel

Mailbox.description: Represents the state of a mailbox.

new_messages.description: Count of new messages in the mailbox.

old_messages.description: Count of old messages in the mailbox.

Message.description: Base type for errors and events

asterisk_id.description: The unique ID for the Asterisk instance that raised this event.

type.description: Indicates the type of this message.

allOf.description: Error event sent when required params are missing.

params.description: A list of the missing parameters

status.description: The running status of this module

support_level.description: The support state of this module

use_count.description: The number of times this module is being used

Peer.description: Detailed information about a remote peer that communicates with Asterisk.

address.description: The IP address of the peer.

cause.description: An optional reason associated with the change in peer_status.

peer_status.description: The current state of the peer. Note that the values of the status are dependent on the underlying peer technology.

time.description: The last known time the peer was contacted.

allOf.description: The state of a peer associated with an endpoint has changed.

Playback.description: Object representing the playback of media to a channel

language.description: For media types that support multiple languages, the language requested for playback.

media_uri.description: The URI for the media currently being played back.

next_media_uri.description: If a list of URIs is being played, the next media URI to be played back.

state.description: Current state of the playback operation.

target_uri.description: URI for the channel or bridge to play the media on

allOf.description: Event showing the continuation of a media playback operation from one media URI to the next in the list.
Event showing the completion of a media playback operation.
Event showing the start of a media playback operation.

channel_uniqueid.description: The Asterisk channel's unique ID that owns this instance.

local_maxrxploss.description: Maximum number of packets lost on local side.

local_minrxploss.description: Minimum number of packets lost on local side.

local_normdevrxploss.description: Average number of packets lost on local side.

local_stdevjitter.description: Standard deviation jitter on local side.

local_stdevrxploss.description: Standard deviation packets lost on local side.

remote_maxrxploss.description: Maximum number of packets lost on remote side.

remote_minrxploss.description: Minimum number of packets lost on remote side.

remote_normdevrxploss.description: Average number of packets lost on remote side.

remote_stdevjitter.description: Standard deviation jitter on remote side.

remote_stdevrxploss.description: Standard deviation packets lost on remote side.

allOf.description: Event showing failure of a recording operation.
Event showing the completion of a recording operation.
Event showing the start of a recording operation.

Sound.description: A media file that may be played back.

formats.description: The formats and languages in which this sound is available.

text.description: Text description of the sound, usually the words spoken.

allOf.description: Notification that a channel has left a Stasis application.
Notification that a channel has entered a Stasis application.

last_reload_time.description: Time when Asterisk was last reloaded.

StoredRecording.description: A past recording that may be played back.

from.description: A technology specific URI specifying the source of the message. For sip and pjsip technologies, any SIP URI can be specified. For xmpp, the URI must correspond to the client connection being used to send the message.

to.description: A technology specific URI specifying the destination of the message. Valid technologies include sip, pjsip, and xmp. The destination of a message should be an endpoint.

variables.description: Technology specific key/value pairs associated with the message.

allOf.description: A text message was received from an endpoint.

TextMessageVariable.description: A key/value pair variable in a text message.

key.description: A unique key identifying the variable.

Variable.description: The value of a channel variable

value.description: The value of the variable requested
